widgets
Class MTChoiceContainer

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      widgets.AbstractGUIWidget
          widgets.MTChoiceContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent, org.mt4j.components.interfaces.IMTComponent3D, org.mt4j.input.IMTInputEventListener, org.mt4j.input.inputProcessors.IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
StdMTChoiceContainer
public abstract class MTChoiceContainer
extends AbstractGUIWidget

This class represents a container for MTCheckButtons. These checkbuttons can be put in this container, which does NOT explicitly handle their alignment or positioning, but groups them and provides them with functionality best known from radiobuttons, letting the checkbuttons act as choice-buttons, where all buttons of one container belong to each other. In order to do that, a special listener will be registered at the added checkbuttons, which forwards tap-gestures right to the container, that then handles the request.
It is up to you to force one button to be checked (except for special ways and means) or to allow the unchecking all of these buttons.

Version:
20110611
Author:
langenhagen

Method Detail

getButtonList

public abstract java.util.List<MTCheckButton> getButtonList()
Retrieves the list of checkbuttons.

Returns:
A List of type MTCheckButton

add

public boolean add(MTCheckButton btn)
Adds a new checkbutton to the container and unchecks it. If this button is already in this container, nothing happens.

Parameters:
btn - The checkbutton as a MTCheckButton
Returns:
Returns TRUE, if the adding was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

remove

public MTCheckButton remove(int i)
Removes a checkbutton with the specified index from this container. If the specified index corresponds to no checkbutton in this container, nothing happens. If the button to remove is the one which is checked, all remaining buttons keep being unchecked.

Parameters:
i - The index at which to remove the checkbutton
Returns:
Returns the removed MTCheckButton or NULL in case of failure.

remove

public MTCheckButton remove(MTCheckButton btn)
Removes a specified checkbutton from this container. If the specified checkbutton is NULL or is not in the container, nothing happens. If the button to remove is the one which is checked, all remaining buttons keep being unchecked.

Parameters:
btn - The MTCheckButton to remove.
Returns:
Returns the removed MTCheckButton if successful or NULL otherwise.

getCheckedButton

public abstract MTCheckButton getCheckedButton()
Retrieves the currently checked button.

Returns:
The checked MTCheckButton or NULL, if no button is checked

setCheckedButton

public boolean setCheckedButton(int i)
Sets the checked button according to its index within this container. If the specified index corresponds to no checkbutton, nothing happens.

Parameters:
i - The index which corresponds to the checkbutton to check.
If the argument is -1 and a null-choice is permitted, all buttons will be unchecked
Returns:
Returns TRUE in case of success, or FALSE otherwise

setCheckedButton

public boolean setCheckedButton(MTCheckButton btn)
Sets the checked button within this container. If the specified checkbutton is not in the container, nothing happens.

Parameters:
btn - The MTCheckButton to check.
If the argument is NULL and a null-choice is permitted, all buttons will be unchecked
Returns:
Returns TRUE in case of success, or FALSE otherwise

setNullChoiceAllowed

public abstract void setNullChoiceAllowed(boolean b)
Specifies, if a button must be checked or not but does not automatically check any button, if set to FALSE an no button is already checked!

Parameters:
b - The specificator as a boolean

isNullChoiceAllowed

public abstract boolean isNullChoiceAllowed()
Indicates, if one button must be checked or not.

Parameters:
b - Returns TRUE, if all buttons unchecked shall be allowed, otherwise returns false
